content: . Additionally, several studies, along with the latest ESC Guidelines on Sports Cardiology and Exercise in Patients with Cardiovascular Disease , suggest that moderate-intensity endurance training, such as aerobic exercise, may have a favorable impact on reducing AF burden with [12, 13] or without  post-catheter ablation, highlighting the significance of the primary and secondary preventive effects of physical activity. It is essential to consider the specifics of each study, including the patient populations, exercise protocols, and follow-up periods
query: exercise tolerance functional capacity amiodarone beta-blockers atrial fibrillation physical activity six minute walk
title: The role of cardiac rehabilitation in patients with atrial fibrillation and heart failure
authors: Andreea Ganea, Gabriel Guşetu, Bogdan Caloian, Dumitru Zdrenghea, Dana Pop
reference: Ganea, A., Guşetu, G., Caloian, B., Zdrenghea, D., & Pop, D. (2024). The role of cardiac rehabilitation in patients with atrial fibrillation and heart failure. Balneo and PRM Research Journal, 15(1), 1-10. https://doi.org/10.12680/balneo.2024.649
